intro: Freycinetia insignis subsp. insignis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a member of the palms family (Arecaceae). It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red fruits containing seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used traditionally by Māori for making baskets and other crafts. The species is also valued for its ecological role in coastal and wetland habitats.
